definition: simply/at all/practically
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: I can't wait to take a bite of the pumpernickel.
sentences.chinese: 我简直迫不及待想吃一口黑包。

sentences.english: It was not easy to work in the shed;in winter it was a veritable ice-box.
sentences.chinese: 在这木棚里工作可不轻松，冬天简直是个冰箱。

sentences.english: The miraculous effect of medical herbs has raised some conservative eyebrows.
sentences.chinese: 草药的奇效简直使一些思想保守的人瞠目结舌。

sentences.english: It is waste of time, admonishing you.
sentences.chinese: 劝告你简直是浪费工夫。

sentences.english: The latest video games are simply stunning.
sentences.chinese: 最新的视频游戏简直让人难以置信。

sentences.english: Such sigh absolutly come from no excuse. such as suddenly thought of life and death.
sentences.chinese: 若干感慨，简直无来由，比如忽然想到生死。

sentences.english: Example: Such a vicious lie could be nothing but a stab in the back.
sentences.chinese: 这种恶毒的谎言简直是暗箭伤人。

sentences.english: Marianne hardly knew what to say.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽安简直不知说什么好。

sentences.english: It looks more a private club than a hotel lounge.
sentences.chinese: 那简直就是一个高档的私人商务会所。

sentences.english: He cumbered himself with an overcoat on a warm day.
sentences.chinese: 大热天穿着件大衣简直使他活受罪。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe that he would steal.
sentences.chinese: 我简直无法相信他会偷东西。

sentences.english: At such an assembly as this, it would be insupportable.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的舞会上跳舞，简直让人受不了。

sentences.english: And now he's on the fast track to win a Nobel prize.
sentences.chinese: 现在他要得诺贝尔奖简直探囊取物。

sentences.english: That humble Aiwowo, yet brings lasting relish on lips and teeth after eating.
sentences.chinese: 那不起眼的艾窝窝，吃完后简直是唇齿留香。

sentences.english: I exclaimed in a rather triumphant tone.
sentences.chinese: 我叫着，简直是一种胜利的腔调。

sentences.english: There"re so many demands on my time that I have very little leisure."
sentences.chinese: 有许多事要花时间去做，简直没有空暇。

definition: indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
really/actually/indeed/true/real/honest/dependable/(philosophy) reality
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
(coll.) nobody can beat that/extraordinary/remarkable
remarkably alike
it could even be said
(slang) come on, you can't deny it!/don't you think so?!/(melodramatic form of 有沒有|有没有)
(neologism c. 2009) don't worry, it's all taken care of
absolute/unconditional
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/go so far as to
really/in fact/genuinely/scrupulously
extremely/exceedingly
super-/ultra-/hyper-
truly/indeed/severely/harshly
(emphasizes that sth is precisely or exactly as stated)/precisely/exactly/even/if/just like/in the same way as
desperately serious/disastrous/extremely/exceedingly
